amendment.description: Amendment provides competitive Teach to Reach grants to eligible partnerships to provide general education teacher candidates with the knowledge and skills to effectively instruct students with disabilities in their classrooms. Eligible partnerships must include an institution of higher education, a special education department within that institution, and a high-need local education agency.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 11 printed in House Report 110-523 to provide competitive Teach to Reach grants to eligible partnerships to provide general education teacher candidates with the knowledge and skills to effectively instruct students with disabilities in their classrooms. Eligible partnerships must include an institution of higher education; a special education department within that institution, and a high-need local education agency.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Yarmuth amendment (A010) Agreed to by voice vote.
